name: Alabaster Potion
oracle_text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text:
Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity.
—D'Avenant proverb

name: Ambush Party
oracle_text: First strike, haste
flavor_text:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King

name: Amulet of Kroog
oracle_text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.

name: Armor of Faith
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Keep your chain mail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
flavor_text: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered.

name: Aurochs
oracle_text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
flavor_text: One auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

name: Aysen Bureaucrats
oracle_text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
flavor_text:
"When one's word is law, one's whim is equally binding."
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

name: Barbed Sextant
oracle_text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add one mana of any color. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Battering Ram
oracle_text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
flavor_text: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

name: Benalish Hero
oracle_text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor_text: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

name: Bird Maiden
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
"Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—*The Arabian Nights*, trans. Haddawy

name: Blessed Wine
oracle_text:
You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"Out there, there are spirits, but here, there is wine."
—Blessing for the bounty of Kjeld

name: Blood Lust
oracle_text: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

name: Bog Imp
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the imp's muck-crusted claws.

name: Bog Rats
oracle_text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.
flavor_text: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

name: Boomerang
oracle_text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return."
—William Shakespeare,
*King Richard the Second*

name: Brainstorm
oracle_text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
flavor_text:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Brainwash
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
flavor_text: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

name: Brassclaw Orcs
oracle_text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor_text:
"Modern Sarpadia's swarming with thrulls. It's a testament to the orcs that they've survived there so long."
—Elbieta, Argivian scholar

name: Brothers of Fire
oracle_text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.
flavor_text: Fire is never a gentle master.

name: Carapace
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor_text:
"Now *that's* a fashion statement."
—Devin, faerie noble

name: Cat Warriors
oracle_text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor_text: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.

name: Chub Toad
oracle_text: Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
Chub toad, chub toad At the door. Run away quick Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

name: Circle of Protection: Black
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Blue
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Green
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Red
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: White
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Clay Statue
oracle_text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
flavor_text: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

name: Cloak of Confusion
oracle_text:
Enchant creature you control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it assign no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player discards a card at random.

name: Counterspell
oracle_text: Counter target spell.

name: Craw Wurm
flavor_text: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Dandân
oracle_text:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.
flavor_text:
"Catch good today. Start replacing crew tomorrow."
—Faysal al-Mousa, fisher captain, log

name: Dark Maze
oracle_text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor_text:
"Stray not onto the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, wizard attendant

name: Dark Ritual
oracle_text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

name: D'Avenant Archer
oracle_text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor_text: Avenant's archers are also trained as poets, so that each arrow is guided by a fragment of verse.

name: Death Speakers
oracle_text: Protection from black
flavor_text:
"The dead may be beyond the law, but speaking the wisdom of the dead will afford no protection!"
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

name: Death Ward
oracle_text: Regenerate target creature.

name: Disenchant
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

name: Disintegrate
oracle_text: Disintegrate deals X damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

name: Divine Offering
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its mana value.
flavor_text: These tears of pain I weep to the skies, Not bitter drops, but water made divine. Each gem of sorrow slips, no longer mine, But proffered thus to echo other cries.

name: Drain Life
oracle_text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

name: Drudge Skeletons
oracle_text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral,
*Necromancer's Handbook*

name: Durkwood Boars
flavor_text:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—*The Bible*, Mark 5:13

name: Dwarven Soldier
oracle_text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Orc must die / Orc must die / Not an orc? / March on by."
—Dwarven marching song

name: Dwarven Warriors
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Enervate
oracle_text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Erg Raiders
oracle_text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

name: Errantry
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
flavor_text:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Eternal Warrior
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
flavor_text: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

name: Fear
oracle_text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Fireball
oracle_text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

name: Firebreathing
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"And topples round the dreary west A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

name: Flare
oracle_text:
Flare deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text: The secret of destruction is simple: everything burns.

name: Flight
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

name: Flood
oracle_text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
flavor_text:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, *Witches and War*

name: Fog
oracle_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

name: Force Spike
oracle_text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor_text:
"Unknown spears / Suddenly hurtle before my dream-awakened eyes . . . ."
—William Butler Yeats, "The Valley of the Black Pig"

name: Foxfire
oracle_text:
Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"Only the foolish fear foxfire."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Frozen Shade
oracle_text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"There are some qualities, some incorporate things, / That have a double life, which thus is made / A type of twin entity which springs / From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

name: Funeral March
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text:
"Turn the key deftly in the oiled wards, And seal the hushed casket of my soul."
—John Keats, "To Sleep"

name: Gaseous Form
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
flavor_text:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare,
*A Midsummer-Night's Dream*

name: Ghazbán Ogre
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.
flavor_text:
"We were holding our own—until the ogre guiding us suddenly grinned and turned on our commander."
—Ivra Jursdotter, Sarpadian mercenary

name: Giant Growth
oracle_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Giant Spider
oracle_text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text: While it possesses potent venom, the giant spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

name: Giant Strength
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
flavor_text:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
*Measure for Measure*

name: Goblin Digging Team
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
flavor_text:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

name: Goblin Hero
flavor_text:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

name: Goblin War Drums
oracle_text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor_text:
"Goblins charge with a deafening war cry. The cry doesn't mean anything—it just drowns out the drums!"
—Reod Dai, mercenary

name: Grapeshot Catapult
oracle_text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor_text: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor_text: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

name: Heal
oracle_text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"Sometimes even the smallest boon can save a life."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

name: Healing Salve
oracle_text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

name: Hill Giant
flavor_text: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

name: Hipparion
oracle_text: Hipparion can't block creatures with power 3 or greater unless you pay {1}.
flavor_text:
"Someone once said that hipparions are to warriors what aesthir are to skyknights. Don't believe it."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Holy Strength
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

name: Homarid Warrior
oracle_text: {U}: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Howl from Beyond
oracle_text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

name: Hungry Mist
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
flavor_text:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow priestess

name: Hurloon Minotaur
flavor_text: The minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

name: Icatian Scout
oracle_text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"In these, our final days, I offer this. Though we could not save Icatia, we gave our children time to grow, and love, before it fell."
—Ailis Connaut, diary

name: Imposing Visage
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor_text: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he met Il-Chunt, the mask's model . . . .

name: Incinerate
oracle_text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
flavor_text:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Initiates of the Ebon Hand
oracle_text: {1}: Add {B}. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor_text:
"We are no longer Nature's children, but her masters . . . ."
—Oath of the Ebon Hand

name: Ironclaw Orcs
oracle_text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
flavor_text: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.

name: Ironroot Treefolk
flavor_text:
"'I'll show you how to handle the treefolk!' the giant bragged, and he strode off into the forest. Two days later he returned, his face masked in sap and a nest behind his ear. None dared ask who won."
—Azeworai, "The Treeling"

name: Kjeldoran Dead
oracle_text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
flavor_text:
"They shall drink sorrow's dregs. They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Krovikan Fetish
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
flavor_text: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.

name: Krovikan Sorcerer
oracle_text:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.

name: Labyrinth Minotaur
oracle_text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor_text:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

name: Ley Druid
oracle_text: {T}: Untap target land.
flavor_text: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

name: Llanowar Elves
oracle_text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor_text:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

name: Lost Soul
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name—but those who go with her are never the same.

name: Marsh Viper
oracle_text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor_text:
"And the seraphs sob at vermin fangs In human gore imbued."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Conqueror Wurm"

name: Memory Lapse
oracle_text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
flavor_text:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor_text: Most human scholars believe that merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

name: Mesa Falcon
oracle_text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Mesa Falcon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The faith of Serra is borne on wings of hope."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Mesa Pegasus
oracle_text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor_text: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the mesa pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a mesa pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

name: Mind Ravel
oracle_text:
Target player discards a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text: An end to reason, an end to order. Forget all that has been.

name: Mindstab Thrull
oracle_text: Whenever Mindstab Thrull attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
flavor_text: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

name: Mountain Goat
oracle_text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor_text:
"Folklore has it that to capture a mountain goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

name: Murk Dwellers
oracle_text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
flavor_text: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

name: Nature's Lore
oracle_text: Search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
flavor_text:
"It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—ah, that is another feat altogether."
—Hannah of Verdura

name: Necrite
oracle_text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.

name: Orcish Conscripts
oracle_text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

name: Orcish Farmer
oracle_text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
flavor_text: There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming.

name: Panic
oracle_text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Paralyze
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If the player does, untap the creature.

name: Pearled Unicorn
flavor_text:
"'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
—Lewis Carroll,
*Through the Looking-Glass*

name: Pestilence
oracle_text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Phantasmal Terrain
oracle_text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

name: Pikemen
oracle_text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor_text:
"As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. 'Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
*Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Pit Scorpion
oracle_text: Whenever Pit Scorpion deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor_text: Sometimes the smallest nuisance can be the greatest pain.

name: Plague Rats
oracle_text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
flavor_text:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease Why ev'n a Rat may plague you . . . ."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

name: Portent
oracle_text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Prismatic Ward
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
As Prismatic Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the chosen color.

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
oracle_text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Psychic Venom
oracle_text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Raise Dead
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Ray of Command
oracle_text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

name: Reef Pirates
oracle_text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player mills a card.
flavor_text: Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.

name: Regeneration
oracle_text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Remove Soul
oracle_text: Counter target creature spell.
flavor_text: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.

name: Repentant Blacksmith
oracle_text: Protection from red
flavor_text:
"For my confession they burned me with fire / And found that I was for endurance made."
—*The Arabian Nights*,
trans. Haddawy

name: Sabretooth Tiger
oracle_text: First strike
flavor_text:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary

name: Samite Healer
oracle_text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

name: Scaled Wurm
flavor_text:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—*Kjeldor: Ice Civilization*

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor_text:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor Spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Scavenger Folk
oracle_text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
flavor_text:
"Stoop, pick, turn, toss. This is the way we mourn our loss."
—Scavenger dirge

name: Scryb Sprites
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Sea Serpent
oracle_text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
flavor_text: Legend has it that serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

name: Shanodin Dryads
oracle_text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor_text: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

name: Shatter
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact.

name: Shield Bearer
oracle_text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor_text:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Shield Wall
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The strongest walls are made not of stone or steel but of the focused strength of warriors.

name: Shrink
oracle_text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."
—Anglo-Saxon curse

name: Soul Barrier
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player unless they pay {2}.
flavor_text:
"The Soul selects her own Society— Then—shuts the Door—"
—Emily Dickinson, "The Soul selects her own Society"

name: Spell Blast
oracle_text: Counter target spell with mana value X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

name: Stone Rain
oracle_text: Destroy target land.

name: Stream of Life
oracle_text: Target player gains X life.

name: Tarpan
oracle_text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
"A good tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Terror
oracle_text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: The Brute
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor_text: After years of being bullied, Fergo reaped the benefits of his newfound strength: he never met a man he didn't want to fight.

name: Torture
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor_text:
"It helps pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

name: Touch of Death
oracle_text:
Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker. You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Tranquility
oracle_text: Destroy all enchantments.

name: Tundra Wolves
oracle_text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

name: Twiddle
oracle_text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Unholy Strength
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

name: Unstable Mutation
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

name: Unsummon
oracle_text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

name: Updraft
oracle_text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"Come one, come all! this rock shall fly From its firm base as soon as I."
—Sir Walter Scott, "The Lady of the Lake"

name: Urza's Mine
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
flavor_text: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

name: Urza's Power Plant
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
flavor_text: Artifact construction required immense resources.

name: Urza's Tower
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {C}{C}{C} instead.
flavor_text: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

name: Vampire Bats
oracle_text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate no more than twice each turn.
flavor_text:
"For something is amiss or out of place / When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Venom
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
flavor_text:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
*Memoirs of a Soldier*

name: Vodalian Soldiers
flavor_text:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

name: Wall of Spears
oracle_text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
flavor_text: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging craw wurms.

name: War Mammoth
oracle_text: Trample
flavor_text: I didn't think mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Weakness
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

name: Wild Growth
oracle_text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.

name: Zephyr Falcon
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text: Although greatly prized among falconers, the zephyr falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
